frameDefinitions: A Cognizer would engage in an Activity if asked or otherwise prompted to do so.

The answer to one open question, the Outcome, is dictated (partially or completely) by the answer to another open question, the Determinant, i.e. if the answer to the Determinant is known, the answer to the Outcome can be predicted.
This frame concerns Communicators communicating with each other with the aid of a Means of communication such as a telephone.
An Entity has a Temperature characterized by the target.
This frame contains items which, when manipulated, alter the function of some device, internal or external.
Due to internal forces/properties, an Entity is inclined towards a particular Behavior, which may be to perform an action or to maintain a state.
frameExamples: The court is <t>willing</t> to depart from the usual range of sentencing .
Economic policy is partially a <t>function</t> of cultural values.
The pan is already too <t>hot</t> to touch.
This <t>button</t> makes the radio turn on.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the individual that is willing to engage in the <fen>Activity</fen>.
The <fen>Activity</fen> is what the <fen>Cognizer</fen> would do under certain circumstances.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is willing to engage in the <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is willing to engage in the <fen>Activity</fen>.
An open question that is (to some degree) predictable from the Determinant.
An open question that determines the <fen>Outcome</fen>.

This role is the person who uses the <fen>Means</fen> of communication to deliver the <fen>Message</fen> to the Addressee. The Speaker is normally expressed as the External Argument of target verbs, or as the Genitive modifier of  nouns.

<fen>Addressee</fen> is the person to whom the <fen>Message</fen> is communicated. When this role is expressed, it often appears in a prepositional phrase introduced by to, or as the direct object, or as the first object in a double object construction.
This role identifies the content that the <fen>Communicator</fen> communicates to the <fen>Addressee</fen>. It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
<fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is typically expressed as a PP Complement headed by about.

This Frame Element refers to the Instrument of Communication that is used by the <fen>Communicator</fen> (and <fen>Addressee</fen>). Each LU in this frame incorporates the <fen>Means</fen> frame element.
The <fen>Entity</fen> for which the temperature <fen>Attribute</fen> is under consideration.
The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion.
A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen>'s state with respect to the temperature <fen>Attribute</fen>.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Temperature</fen> from the norm.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular <fen>Degree</fen> for the temperature <fen>Attribute</fen>.
This role identifies the entity or substance that is designed to have a particular <fen>Use</fen>. This is often an incorporated FE.
TheFrame Element <fen>Entity</fen> identifies the person or thing that has a tendency towards some Behaviour.
The role <fen>Behavior</fen> marks expressions that indicate which state or action the <fen>Entity</fen> tends towards.
listRoleExamples: <fex>My mom</fex> is very loath to take any drugs without medical supervision.
Does biology really matter more than a willingness <fex>to take an active role in a child's life</fex>?
Price, in such a case, depends <fex>only on the whim of the supplier</fex>.
<fex>The President</fex> cabled his assistant to cancel all of his appointments.
The President cabled <fex>his assistant</fex> to cancel all other engagements.
The skillet had a temperature <fex>of 230 F</fex>
<fex>Lubomir</fex> was not inclined to believe me
Martha has a tendency <fex>to overdo the housekeeping</fex>.
